name: Americano
recipe: 1 oz Compari, 1 sweet red vermouth, 2 oz soda water
description: Build in old-fashioned glass, add ice, top with soda water. Garnish with orange peel.

name: Bloody Mary
recipe: Worcestershire sauce, Tobasco, salt, pepper, 1/2 (1 part) lemon juice, 1 1/2 oz (3 parts) vodka, 3 oz (6 parts) tomato juice
description: Add dashes of Worcestershire sauce, Tobasco, salt and pepper into highball glass, then pour all ingredients into highball with ice cubes. Stir gently. Garnish with celery stalk and lemon wedge (optional).

name: Boulevardier
recipe: 1 oz Compari, 1 oz to 1 1/2 oz rye whiskey or bourbon, 1 oz sweet red vermouth
description: Stir with ice, strain into old-fashioned glass. Garnish with orange peel or cherry and serve.

name: Cape Codder
recipe: 1 part Vodka, 1 to 4 part cranberry juice to taste
description: Build all ingredients in highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

name: Corpse Reviver #2
recipe: 3/4 oz Gin, 3/4 Cointreau, 3/4 Lillet Blanc, 3/4 lemon juice, 1/2 tsp absinthe
description: Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange twist.

name: Cosmopolitan
recipe: 1 1/2 oz Vodka, 3/4 oz Cointreau, 1 oz cranberry juice, 1/4 oz lime juice
description: Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange twist.

name: Cuba Libre
recipe: 4 oz cola, 1/3 oz fresh lime juice, 1 2/3 oz white rum
description: Build all ingredients in highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

name: Daiquiri
recipe: 2 1/2 oz Rum, 3/4 oz lime juice, 1/2 oz simple syrup (2:1)
description: Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with lime wheel.

name: Dark and Stormy
recipe: 2 oz Dark rum, couple dashes of bitters, 3 1/3 oz ginger beer
description: In highball glass filled with ice, add dark rum and bitters and top with ginger beer. Garnish with lime wedge.

name: Gin and Tonic
recipe: 1 part to 3 parts gin (to taste), 3 parts tonic water
description: In glass filled with ice cubes, add gin and tonic.

name: Gin Fizz
recipe: 1 3/4 oz Gin, 2 oz soda water, 3/4 oz lime juice, 1/2 oz simple syrup (2:1)
description: Shake and top with soda water. Strain into chilled footed highball glass. No ice. No garnish.

name: Grasshopper
recipe: 1 1/2 oz Creme de menthe, 1 1/2 oz creme de cacao, 4 oz vanilla ice cream, 8 oz crushed ice, 1 oz half-and-half, 1 tsp Fernet Branca, pinch salt
description: Blend. Serve in milkshake glass. Garnish with fresh mint.

name: Irish Coffee
recipe: 3 oz Hot coffee, 1 1/2 Irish whiskey, 2 tsp sugar, 1 oz fresh cream
description: Add sugar, whiskey, and coffee to pre-warmed glass. Top with cream.

name: Mai Tai
recipe: 1 1/2 oz Light rum, 1/2 oz dark rum, 1/2 oz orgeat, 1/2 oz Grand Marnier, 1/4 oz simple syrup (2:1), 1 1/4 oz fresh lime juice, plus used lime hull
description: Shake and strain over pebble ice in chilled old-fashioned glass. Garnish with used lime hull and mint bouquet.

name: Manhattan
recipe: 2 oz Rye, 1 oz sweet red vermouth, 2 dashes Angostura bitters
description: Stir with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with brandied cherry.

name: Margarita
recipe: 1 1/2 oz Tequila, 3/4 oz lime juice, 3/4 Cointreau, 1 simple syrup (2:1)
description: Rub the rim of the glass with the lime slice to make the salt stick to it. Shake the other ingredients with ice, then carefully pour into glass (taking care not to dislodge any salt). Garnish with lime slice and serve over ice in margarita glass.

name: Martini
recipe: 1/2 oz Dry vermouth, 2 1/2 oz gin
description: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain in chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto drink, or garnish with olive.

name: Mimosa
recipe: 2 1/2 oz (1 part) Orange juice, 2 1/2 (1 part) champagne
description: Ensure both ingredients are well chilled, then mix into glass. Serve cold.

name: Mint Julep
recipe: 2 oz Bourbon, 1 tsp simple syrup (2:1), 8-10 mint leaves
description: Muddle mint and simple syrup in chilled julep cup. Add bourbon and stir. Slowly add pebble ice, stirring. Mound ice on top. Garnish with mint bouquet and serve with straw.

name: Mojito
recipe: 1 1/2 oz White rum, 3/4 oz lime juice, 1/2 oz simple syrup (2:1), 1-2 sprigs mint
description: Muddle mint with simple syrup in mixing glass or tin. Add lime juice and lime hull, and rum. Add to milkshare glass and top with ice and soda. Roll drink back and forth in mixing glass. Top with ice and garnish with mint bouquet.

name: Negroni
recipe: 1 oz Gin, 1 oz Campari, 1 oz sweet vermouth
description: Stir and strain into cocktail glass over ice. Garnish with orange twist and serve.

name: Old-fashioned
recipe: 2 oz Bourbon, 1 tsp simple syrup (2:1), 2 dashes Angostura bitters
description: Stir with ice and strain over large cube in frozen old-fashioned glass. Garnish with orange twist.

name: Pimm's Cup
recipe: 1/2 inch-thick English cucumber wheel, 1/2 inch-thick lemon wheel, 2 oz Pimm's No. 1, 1.4 oz lemon-lime soda, lemon-lime soda or ginger ale
description: Gently muddle the cucumber and lemon slices in chilled highball glass. Pour in Pimm's and lemon-lime soda or ginger ale, and stir to combine. Add ice to fill glass and garnish with lemon twist.

name: Pisco Sour
recipe: 2 oz Pisco, 1/2 oz lime juice, 3/4 oz simple syrup (2:1), 1/2 oz egg white
description: Dry shake, shake with ice, and strain into chilled footed highball glass. Twist orange peel over surface and discard peel. Decorate with Angostura bitters art in the foam.

name: Sazerac
recipe: 2 oz Rye, 1 tsp simple syrup (2:1), 3 dashes Peychaud's bitters, 1 dash Angostra bitters
description: Stir and strain into small whiskey glass rinsed with absinthe. Twist lemon peel over surface, then discard.

name: Sidecar
recipe: 1 1/2 oz Cognac, 3/4 oz Cointreau, 3/4 oz lemon juice, 1 tsp simple syrup (2:1)
description: Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange twist.

name: Tequila Sunrise
recipe: 1 1/2 oz (3 parts) Tequila, 3 oz (6 parts) orange juice, 1/2 oz (1 part) grenadine syrup
description: Pour tequila and orange juice into collins glass over ice. Add grenadine, which will sink to the bottom. Do not stir. Garnish with orange slice and cherry and serve.

name: Tom Collins
recipe: 2 oz gin, 2 oz club soda, 3/4 oz lemon juice, 1/2 oz simple syrup
description: Shake and top with club soda. Strain into chilled collins glass. Garnish with lemon twist.

name: Whiskey Sour
recipe: 1 oz fresh lemon juice, 1/2 oz gomme syrup, 1/2 oz egg white, 2 oz bourbon whiskey
description: Shake with ice. Strain into ice-filled old-fashioned glass. Garnish with cherry, lemon rind and orange slice.

name: White Russian
recipe: 1 1/2 oz Coffee liqueur, 1 oz vodka, 1 oz fresh cream
description: Pour coffee liqueur and vodka into old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Float fresh cream on top and stir slowly.
